Finance Manager Job at Devyani International Nigeria Ltd




        
    

        
        Devyani International (Nigeria) Ltd. is a franchisee of Yum Inc. operating KFC Restaurants in Nigeria. In a short span of it's presence, it has become an industry leader offering superior products and world class service. KFC Nigeria is a leading quick-service restaurant chain, part of the global Yum! Brands family, committed to delivering finger-licking' good food and exceptional customer experiences across our outlets in Nigeria. We pride ourselves on fostering a dynamic, inclusive work environment where innovation, integrity, and teamwork drive our success in the fast-paced food industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Isolo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Finance
Reports To: Head of Finance

Role Overview


	The Finance Manager will be responsible for overseeing the financial operations of across all stores and the RSC office.
	The role requires strong hands-on capability in financial reporting, payroll verification, statutory compliance, reconciliations, systems management (Tally and SAP), and coordination of multi-location finance activities.
	The ideal candidate must be a Chartered Accountant (ICAN) with solid experience in retail, QSR, FMCG, or multi-site operations.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Reporting & MISL:


	Post monthly journals and prepare accurate monthly MIS and Profit & Loss reports for all stores and the head office.
	Ensure timely month-end and year-end financial closing in line with internal controls and reporting timelines.
	Prepare SAP uploaders from approved schedules and ensure accurate uploading into SAP.


Payroll & Employee Cost Management:


	Perform monthly verification of payroll across all employee categories including expatriates, permanent staff, contract staff, and part-time employees.
	Prepare and maintain Cost to Company (CTC) schedules for all staff categories.
	Review exit documentation and post Full and Final (F&F) settlement entries in Tally.


Accounts Payable, Rentals & Vendor Management:


	Post all rental and service charge bills for store locations and expatriate residences.
	Review vendor onboarding documents and ensure completeness before creating supplier profiles in Tally.
	Reconcile mall landlords’ accounts and manage profit-sharing arrangements where applicable.
	Collate monthly Month-to-Date (MTD) Daily Sales Reports (DSR) for calculating Yum fees and landlord profit-sharing.


Schedules, Provisions & Reconciliations:


	Maintain and regularly update financial schedules including rent schedules, insurance, AMC, and related commitments.
	Prepare and update provision schedules for both head office and store operations.
	Prepare monthly sales, consumption, and output VAT reconciliations for all stores and ensure compliance with tax regulations.


Inventory & Controls:


	Coordinate the annual stock take exercise across all stores in collaboration with Store Finance Managers (SFM) and operations teams.
	Strengthen financial controls to minimize leakages and ensure compliance with company policies.


Compliance & Audit:


	Support internal and external audits by providing schedules, reconciliations, and documentation as required.
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian financial regulations, tax laws, and internal financial standards.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related discipline.
	Minimum of 5–8 years of relevant finance experience, preferably in QSR, retail, FMCG, or multi-location operations.
	Chartered Accountant qualification (ICAN) is mandatory.
	Strong working knowledge of Tally and SAP.
	Proven experience in payroll management, MIS reporting, VAT reconciliation, and multi-store finance operations.


Remuneration
Competitive+ HMO, Pension, NHF, 13th Month and other company wide benefits.

Note: Only qualified and experienced candidates will be shortlisted.

Human Resource Staff Job at Express Resource Connect




        
    

        
        Express Resource Connect, we understand the unique challenges businesses face and are committed to delivering tailored solutions that align with your goals. Our outsourcing services offer: Expert Talent: Access to a highly skilled workforce with specialized expertise. Cost-Effective Solutions: Streamlined processes that reduce overhead without compromising quality. Scalability: Flexibility to scale operations in response to your evolving needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Staff
Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a reliable and detail-oriented HR Staff to manage and support day-to-day human resource operations. The ideal candidate will demonstrate high integrity, emotional intelligence, and professionalism in handling staff-related matters while ensuring compliance with company policies and best HR practices.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and maintain accurate employee records, HR documentation, and databases.
	Handle employee relations issues, including grievances and disciplinary matters, with professionalism and confidentiality.
	Support recruitment and onboarding processes to ensure smooth integration of new hires.
	Assist with payroll inputs, leave administration, and staff benefits coordination.
	Prepare HR reports, presentations, and internal communications while ensuring compliance with company policies and labor regulations.


Requirements


	Proven experience in an HR role with a strong understanding of core HR operations.
	High level of integrity and discretion in handling confidential information.
	Strong emotional intelligence and interpersonal skills for managing staff matters.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
	Banking or finance sector experience is an added advantage.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@express-resource.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.
